intro: Thouinia mauritiana, commonly known as the Mauritius starflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, star-shaped white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Thouinia mauritiana is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
